ayas.arabic: الٓمٓر ۚ تِلْكَ ءَايَـٰتُ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ ۗ وَٱلَّذِىٓ أُنزِلَ إِلَيْكَ مِن رَّبِّكَ ٱلْحَقُّ وَلَـٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَ ٱلنَّاسِ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ
ayas.translation: ALIF LAM MIM RA. These are the verses of the Scripture. Whatsoever is sent down to you from your Lord is the truth; but most men do not believe.
ayas.transliteration: alif lām mīm rā ۚ tilka āyātul kitāb ۗ wal ladhī unzila ilayka min rabbikal ḥaqqu walākinna aktharan nāsi lā yu-minūn

bismillah.translation: In the name of Allah, most benevolent, ever-merciful.

ayas.arabic: ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِى رَفَعَ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ بِغَيْرِ عَمَدٍ تَرَوْنَهَا ۖ ثُمَّ ٱسْتَوَىٰ عَلَى ٱلْعَرْشِ ۖ وَسَخَّرَ ٱلشَّمْسَ وَٱلْقَمَرَ ۖ كُلٌّ يَجْرِى لِأَجَلٍ مُّسَمًّى ۚ يُدَبِّرُ ٱلْأَمْرَ يُفَصِّلُ ٱلْـَٔايَـٰتِ لَعَلَّكُم بِلِقَآءِ رَبِّكُمْ تُوقِنُونَ
ayas.translation: It is God who raised the skies without support, as you can see, then assumed His throne, and enthralled the sun and the moon (so that) each runs to a predetermined course. He disposes all affairs, distinctly explaining every sign that you may be certain of the meeting with your Lord.
ayas.transliteration: allāhul ladhī rafa`as samāwāti bighayri `amadin tarawnahā ۖ thummas-tawā `alal-`arsh ۖ wasakhharash shamsa wal qamar ۖ kullun yajrī li-ajalin musammā ۚ yudabbirul-amra yufaṣṣilul-āyāti la`allakum biliqā-i rabbikum tūqinūn

ayas.arabic: وَهُوَ ٱلَّذِى مَدَّ ٱلْأَرْضَ وَجَعَلَ فِيهَا رَوَٰسِىَ وَأَنْهَـٰرًا ۖ وَمِن كُلِّ ٱلثَّمَرَٰتِ جَعَلَ فِيهَا زَوْجَيْنِ ٱثْنَيْنِ ۖ يُغْشِى ٱلَّيْلَ ٱلنَّهَارَ ۚ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَـٰتٍ لِّقَوْمٍ يَتَفَكَّرُونَ
ayas.translation: It is He who stretched the earth and placed upon it stabilisers and rivers; and made two of a pair of every fruit; (and) He covers up the day with the night. In these are signs for those who reflect.
ayas.transliteration: wahuwal ladhī maddal-arḍa waja`ala fīhā rawāsiya wa-anhārā ۖ wa min kullith thamarāti ja`ala fīhā zawjaynith-nayn ۖ yughshil laylan nahār ۚ inna fī dhālika la-āyātin liqawmiy yatafakkarūn

ayas.arabic: وَفِى ٱلْأَرْضِ قِطَعٌ مُّتَجَـٰوِرَٰتٌ وَجَنَّـٰتٌ مِّنْ أَعْنَـٰبٍ وَزَرْعٌ وَنَخِيلٌ صِنْوَانٌ وَغَيْرُ صِنْوَانٍ يُسْقَىٰ بِمَآءٍ وَٰحِدٍ وَنُفَضِّلُ بَعْضَهَا عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ فِى ٱلْأُكُلِ ۚ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَـٰتٍ لِّقَوْمٍ يَعْقِلُونَ
ayas.translation: On the earth are tracts adjoining one another, and vineyards, fields of corn and date-palm trees, some forked, some with single trunks, yet all irrigated by the self-same water, though We make some more excellent than the others in fruit. There are surely signs in them for those who understand.
ayas.transliteration: wafil-arḍi qiṭa`un mutajāwirātun wajannātun min a`nābin wazar`un wanakhīlun ṣinwānun waghayru ṣinwāniy yusqā bimā-in wāḥidin wanufaḍḍilu ba`ḍahā `alā ba`ḍin fil-ukul ۚ inna fī dhālika la-āyātin liqawmiy ya`qilūn

ayas.arabic: وَإِن تَعْجَبْ فَعَجَبٌ قَوْلُهُمْ أَءِذَا كُنَّا تُرَٰبًا أَءِنَّا لَفِى خَلْقٍ جَدِيدٍ ۗ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ بِرَبِّهِمْ ۖ وَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ ٱلْأَغْلَـٰلُ فِىٓ أَعْنَاقِهِمْ ۖ وَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ أَصْحَـٰبُ ٱلنَّارِ ۖ هُمْ فِيهَا خَـٰلِدُونَ
ayas.translation: If you are surprised, then astonishing is the speech (of those who say:) "Having turned to dust shall we be raised as a new creation?" They are the ones who deny their Lord, and they will have collars around their necks. They are the inmates of Hell, where they will abide for ever.
ayas.transliteration: wa in ta`jab fa`ajabun qawluhum a-idhā kunnā turāban a-innā lafī khalqin jadīd ۗ ulā-ikal ladhīna kafarū birabbihim ۖ wa-ulā-ikal-aghlālu fī a`nāqihim ۖ wa-ulā-ika aṣ-ḥābun nār ۖ hum fīhā khālidūn

ayas.arabic: وَيَسْتَعْجِلُونَكَ بِٱلسَّيِّئَةِ قَبْلَ ٱلْحَسَنَةِ وَقَدْ خَلَتْ مِن قَبْلِهِمُ ٱلْمَثُلَـٰتُ ۗ وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَذُو مَغْفِرَةٍ لِّلنَّاسِ عَلَىٰ ظُلْمِهِمْ ۖ وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَشَدِيدُ ٱلْعِقَابِ
ayas.translation: They want you to hasten the evil before the good, even when there have been examples of retribution before them. Though certainly your Lord forgives human beings for their iniquities, your Lord is severe of retribution.
ayas.transliteration: wayasta`jilūnaka bis sayyi-ati qablal-ḥasanati waqad khalat min qablihimul mathulāt ۗ wa inna rabbaka ladhū maghfiratin linnāsi `alā ẓul-mihim ۖ wa inna rabbaka lashadīdul `iqāb

ayas.arabic: وَيَقُولُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لَوْلَآ أُنزِلَ عَلَيْهِ ءَايَةٌ مِّن رَّبِّهِۦٓ ۗ إِنَّمَآ أَنتَ مُنذِرٌ ۖ وَلِكُلِّ قَوْمٍ هَادٍ
ayas.translation: The unbelievers say: "Why no miracle was sent down to him by his Lord?" But you are only a bearer of warnings, and a guide for every nation.
ayas.transliteration: wayaqūlul ladhīna kafarū lawlā unzila `alayhi āyatun min rabbih ۗ innamā anta mundhir ۖ walikulli qawmin hād

ayas.arabic: ٱللَّهُ يَعْلَمُ مَا تَحْمِلُ كُلُّ أُنثَىٰ وَمَا تَغِيضُ ٱلْأَرْحَامُ وَمَا تَزْدَادُ ۖ وَكُلُّ شَىْءٍ عِندَهُۥ بِمِقْدَارٍ
ayas.translation: God is cognisant of what every female carries in her womb, or what the wombs want or exceed (of their disburdening time). With Him all things are in determined measure.
ayas.transliteration: allāhu ya`lamu mā taḥmilu kullu unthā wa mā taghīḍul-arḥāmu wa mā tazdād ۖ wakullu shay-in `indahu bimiqdār

ayas.arabic: عَـٰلِمُ ٱلْغَيْبِ وَٱلشَّهَـٰدَةِ ٱلْكَبِيرُ ٱلْمُتَعَالِ
ayas.translation: He is the knower of the known and the unknown, the mighty and most high.
ayas.transliteration: `ālimul ghaybi wash shahādatil kabīrul muta`āl

ayas.arabic: سَوَآءٌ مِّنكُم مَّنْ أَسَرَّ ٱلْقَوْلَ وَمَن جَهَرَ بِهِۦ وَمَنْ هُوَ مُسْتَخْفٍۭ بِٱلَّيْلِ وَسَارِبٌۢ بِٱلنَّهَارِ
ayas.translation: He who keeps his secret among you is the same to Him as he who speaks out publicly, and he who hides himself in the night and walks freely in the day.
ayas.transliteration: sawā-un minkum man asarral qawla wa man jahara bihi wa man huwa mustakhfin bil layli wasāribun bin nahār

ayas.arabic: لَهُۥ مُعَقِّبَـٰتٌ مِّنۢ بَيْنِ يَدَيْهِ وَمِنْ خَلْفِهِۦ يَحْفَظُونَهُۥ مِنْ أَمْرِ ٱللَّهِ ۗ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يُغَيِّرُ مَا بِقَوْمٍ حَتَّىٰ يُغَيِّرُوا۟ مَا بِأَنفُسِهِمْ ۗ وَإِذَآ أَرَادَ ٱللَّهُ بِقَوْمٍ سُوٓءًا فَلَا مَرَدَّ لَهُۥ ۚ وَمَا لَهُم مِّن دُونِهِۦ مِن وَالٍ
ayas.translation: His angels keep watch over him in succession (night and day), in front and behind, by God's command. Verily God does not change the state of a people till they change themselves. When God intends misfortune for a people no one can avert it, and no saviour will they have apart from Him.
ayas.transliteration: lahu mu`aqqibātun min bayni yadayhi wa min khalfihi yaḥfaẓūnahu min amrillāh ۗ innallāha lā yughayyiru mā biqawmin ḥattā yughayyirū mā bi-anfusihim ۗ wa idhā arādallāhu biqawmin sū-an falā maradda lah ۚ wa mā lahum min dūnihi min wāl

ayas.arabic: هُوَ ٱلَّذِى يُرِيكُمُ ٱلْبَرْقَ خَوْفًا وَطَمَعًا وَيُنشِئُ ٱلسَّحَابَ ٱلثِّقَالَ
ayas.translation: It is He who makes the lightning flash for fear and hope, and raises massive clouds.
ayas.transliteration: huwal ladhī yurīkumul barqa khawfan waṭama`an wayunshi-us saḥābath thiqāl

ayas.arabic: وَيُسَبِّحُ ٱلرَّعْدُ بِحَمْدِهِۦ وَٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةُ مِنْ خِيفَتِهِۦ وَيُرْسِلُ ٱلصَّوَٰعِقَ فَيُصِيبُ بِهَا مَن يَشَآءُ وَهُمْ يُجَـٰدِلُونَ فِى ٱللَّهِ وَهُوَ شَدِيدُ ٱلْمِحَالِ
ayas.translation: The thunder sings His praises, and the angels too, for awe of Him. He sends thunder-bolts and strikes whosoever He will with them: Even then it is God they contend about! But mighty is He in (His) power.
ayas.transliteration: wayusabbiḥur ra`du biḥamdihi wal malā-ikatu min khīfatihi wayursiluṣ ṣawā`iqa fayuṣību bihā man yashā-u wahum yujādilūna fillāhi wahuwa shadīdul miḥāl

ayas.arabic: لَهُۥ دَعْوَةُ ٱلْحَقِّ ۖ وَٱلَّذِينَ يَدْعُونَ مِن دُونِهِۦ لَا يَسْتَجِيبُونَ لَهُم بِشَىْءٍ إِلَّا كَبَـٰسِطِ كَفَّيْهِ إِلَى ٱلْمَآءِ لِيَبْلُغَ فَاهُ وَمَا هُوَ بِبَـٰلِغِهِۦ ۚ وَمَا دُعَآءُ ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ إِلَّا فِى ضَلَـٰلٍ
ayas.translation: To call on Him is true (supplication). For those they invoke other than Him do not answer them at all, except like a man who stretches his hands towards the water that it reach his mouth, but it will never reach it. Not more than error are the prayers of infidels.
ayas.transliteration: lahu da`watul ḥaqq ۖ wal ladhīna yad`ūna min dūnihi lā yastajībūna lahum bishay-in illā kabāsiṭi kaffayhi ilal-mā-i liyablugha fāhu wa mā huwa bibālighih ۚ wa mā du`ā-ul kāfirīna illā fī ḍalāl

ayas.arabic: وَلِلَّهِ يَسْجُدُ مَن فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ طَوْعًا وَكَرْهًا وَظِلَـٰلُهُم بِٱلْغُدُوِّ وَٱلْـَٔاصَالِ ۩
ayas.translation: Whosoever is in the heavens and on earth bows to God in submission with a will or perforce, as do their shadows in the morning and evening.
ayas.transliteration: walillāhi yasjudu man fis samāwāti wal-arḍi ṭaw`an wakarhan waẓilāluhum bil ghuduwwi wal-āṣāl ۩

ayas.arabic: قُلْ مَن رَّبُّ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ قُلِ ٱللَّهُ ۚ قُلْ أَفَٱتَّخَذْتُم مِّن دُونِهِۦٓ أَوْلِيَآءَ لَا يَمْلِكُونَ لِأَنفُسِهِمْ نَفْعًا وَلَا ضَرًّا ۚ قُلْ هَلْ يَسْتَوِى ٱلْأَعْمَىٰ وَٱلْبَصِيرُ أَمْ هَلْ تَسْتَوِى ٱلظُّلُمَـٰتُ وَٱلنُّورُ ۗ أَمْ جَعَلُوا۟ لِلَّهِ شُرَكَآءَ خَلَقُوا۟ كَخَلْقِهِۦ فَتَشَـٰبَهَ ٱلْخَلْقُ عَلَيْهِمْ ۚ قُلِ ٱللَّهُ خَـٰلِقُ كُلِّ شَىْءٍ وَهُوَ ٱلْوَٰحِدُ ٱلْقَهَّـٰرُ
ayas.translation: Ask them: "Who is the Lord of the heavens and the earth?" (They will) say: "God." Say: "Then why do you take protectors besides Him who have no power over their own gain or loss?" Say: "Can a blind man and one who can see be equal? Or, darkness and light be the same? Or, have those they have appointed equal of God created, as He has created, so that the (two) creations look alike to them?" Say: "God is the creator of everything. He is One, the omnipotent."
ayas.transliteration: qul man rabbus samāwāti wal-arḍi qulillāh ۚ qul afattakhadhtum min dūnihi awliyā-a lā yamlikūna li-anfusihim naf`an walā ḍarrā ۚ qul hal yastawil-a`mā wal baṣīru am hal tastawiẓ ẓulumātu wan nūr ۗ am ja`alū lillāhi shurakā-a khalaqū kakhalqihi fatashābahal khalqu `alayhim ۚ qulillāhu khāliqu kulli shay-in wahuwal wāḥidul qahhār

ayas.arabic: أَنزَلَ مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءً فَسَالَتْ أَوْدِيَةٌۢ بِقَدَرِهَا فَٱحْتَمَلَ ٱلسَّيْلُ زَبَدًا رَّابِيًا ۚ وَمِمَّا يُوقِدُونَ عَلَيْهِ فِى ٱلنَّارِ ٱبْتِغَآءَ حِلْيَةٍ أَوْ مَتَـٰعٍ زَبَدٌ مِّثْلُهُۥ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يَضْرِبُ ٱللَّهُ ٱلْحَقَّ وَٱلْبَـٰطِلَ ۚ فَأَمَّا ٱلزَّبَدُ فَيَذْهَبُ جُفَآءً ۖ وَأَمَّا مَا يَنفَعُ ٱلنَّاسَ فَيَمْكُثُ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يَضْرِبُ ٱللَّهُ ٱلْأَمْثَالَ
ayas.translation: He sends down water from the skies, which flows in channels according to their capacity, with the scum borne on the surface of the torrent, as rises the scum when metals are heated on the fire for making ornaments and household utensils. This is how God determines truth and falsehood. The scum disappears like the foam on the bank, and that which is useful to man remains on the earth. That is how God sets forth precepts of wisdom.
ayas.transliteration: anzala minas samā-i mā-an fasālat awdiyatun biqadarihā faḥtamalas saylu zabadan rābiyā ۚ wa mimmā yūqidūna `alayhi fin nārib-tighā-a ḥilyatin aw matā`in zabadun mithluh ۚ kadhālika yaḍribullāhul ḥaqqa wal bāṭil ۚ fa-ammaz zabadu fayadh-habu jufā-ā ۖ wa-ammā mā yanfa`un nāsa fayamkuthu fil-arḍ ۚ kadhālika yaḍribullāhul-amthāl

ayas.arabic: لِلَّذِينَ ٱسْتَجَابُوا۟ لِرَبِّهِمُ ٱلْحُسْنَىٰ ۚ وَٱلَّذِينَ لَمْ يَسْتَجِيبُوا۟ لَهُۥ لَوْ أَنَّ لَهُم مَّا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ جَمِيعًا وَمِثْلَهُۥ مَعَهُۥ لَٱفْتَدَوْا۟ بِهِۦٓ ۚ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ لَهُمْ سُوٓءُ ٱلْحِسَابِ وَمَأْوَىٰهُمْ جَهَنَّمُ ۖ وَبِئْسَ ٱلْمِهَادُ
ayas.translation: For those who obey their Lord is excellence. For those who fail to obey, the reckoning will be hard, even if they possess and give as ransom all that there is on the earth, and as much more; and Hell will be their abode: How wretched is its wide expanse!
ayas.transliteration: lilladhīnas-tajābū lirabbihimul ḥusnā ۚ wal ladhīna lam yastajībū lahu law anna lahum mā fil-arḍi jamī`an wa mithlahu ma`ahu laftadaw bih ۚ ulā-ika lahum sū-ul ḥisābi wa ma-wāhum jahannam ۖ wabi-sal mihād

ayas.arabic: أَفَمَن يَعْلَمُ أَنَّمَآ أُنزِلَ إِلَيْكَ مِن رَّبِّكَ ٱلْحَقُّ كَمَنْ هُوَ أَعْمَىٰٓ ۚ إِنَّمَا يَتَذَكَّرُ أُو۟لُوا۟ ٱلْأَلْبَـٰبِ
ayas.translation: Can a man who knows what has been revealed to you from your Lord is the truth, and one who cannot see, be the same? They alone take warning who are wise,
ayas.transliteration: afaman ya`lamu annamā unzila ilayka min rabbikal ḥaqqu kaman huwa a`mā ۚ innamā yatadhakkaru ulul-albāb

ayas.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ يُوفُونَ بِعَهْدِ ٱللَّهِ وَلَا يَنقُضُونَ ٱلْمِيثَـٰقَ
ayas.translation: Who fulfil their covenant with God and do not break their agreement,
ayas.transliteration: alladhīna yūfūna bi`ahdillāhi walā yanquḍūnal mīthāq

ayas.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ يَصِلُونَ مَآ أَمَرَ ٱللَّهُ بِهِۦٓ أَن يُوصَلَ وَيَخْشَوْنَ رَبَّهُمْ وَيَخَافُونَ سُوٓءَ ٱلْحِسَابِ
ayas.translation: Who keep together what God has ordained held together, and fear their Lord and dread the hardship of the Reckoning,
ayas.transliteration: wal ladhīna yaṣilūna mā amarallāhu bihi an yūṣala wayakhshawna rabbahum wayakhāfūna sū al ḥisāb

ayas.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ صَبَرُوا۟ ٱبْتِغَآءَ وَجْهِ رَبِّهِمْ وَأَقَامُوا۟ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَأَنفَقُوا۟ مِمَّا رَزَقْنَـٰهُمْ سِرًّا وَعَلَانِيَةً وَيَدْرَءُونَ بِٱلْحَسَنَةِ ٱلسَّيِّئَةَ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ لَهُمْ عُقْبَى ٱلدَّارِ
ayas.translation: Who persevere in seeking the way of their Lord, who fulfil their devotional obligations, and spend of what We have given them, secretly or openly, who repel evil with good: For them is the recompense of Paradise:
ayas.transliteration: wal ladhīna ṣabarub-tighā-a wajhi rabbihim wa-aqāmuṣ ṣalāta wa-anfaqū mimmā razaqnāhum sirran wa`alāniyatan wayadra-ūna bil ḥasanatis sayyi-ata ulā-ika lahum `uqbad dār

ayas.arabic: جَنَّـٰتُ عَدْنٍ يَدْخُلُونَهَا وَمَن صَلَحَ مِنْ ءَابَآئِهِمْ وَأَزْوَٰجِهِمْ وَذُرِّيَّـٰتِهِمْ ۖ وَٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةُ يَدْخُلُونَ عَلَيْهِم مِّن كُلِّ بَابٍ
ayas.translation: Perpetual gardens which they will enter with those of their fathers, spouses and children who were virtuous and at peace, with angels coming in through every door
ayas.transliteration: jannātu `adniy yadkhulūnahā wa man ṣalaḥa min ābā-ihim wa-azwājihim wadhurriyyātihim ۖ wal malā-ikatu yadkhulūna `alayhim min kulli bāb

ayas.arabic: سَلَـٰمٌ عَلَيْكُم بِمَا صَبَرْتُمْ ۚ فَنِعْمَ عُقْبَى ٱلدَّارِ
ayas.translation: Saying: "(Welcome,) peace on you, for you persevered." How excellent the recompense of Paradise!
ayas.transliteration: salāmun `alaykum bimā ṣabartum ۚ fani`ma `uqbad dār

ayas.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ يَنقُضُونَ عَهْدَ ٱللَّهِ مِنۢ بَعْدِ مِيثَـٰقِهِۦ وَيَقْطَعُونَ مَآ أَمَرَ ٱللَّهُ بِهِۦٓ أَن يُوصَلَ وَيُفْسِدُونَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ ۙ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ لَهُمُ ٱللَّعْنَةُ وَلَهُمْ سُوٓءُ ٱلدَّارِ
ayas.translation: As for those who break God's covenant after validating it, and sever relations which God ordained cohered, and spread corruption in the land, there is condemnation for them and an evil abode.
ayas.transliteration: wal ladhīna yanquḍūna `ahdallāhi min ba`di mīthāqihi wayaqṭa`ūna mā amarallāhu bihi an yūṣala wayufsidūna fil-arḍi ulā-ika lahumulla`natu walahum sū-ud dār

ayas.arabic: ٱللَّهُ يَبْسُطُ ٱلرِّزْقَ لِمَن يَشَآءُ وَيَقْدِرُ ۚ وَفَرِحُوا۟ بِٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا وَمَا ٱلْحَيَوٰةُ ٱلدُّنْيَا فِى ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ إِلَّا مَتَـٰعٌ
ayas.translation: God increases or decreases the fortunes of whosoever He will, and they rejoice in the life of this world. Yet the life of this world is nothing but a merchandise as compared to the life of the next.
ayas.transliteration: allāhu yabsuṭur rizqa liman yashā-u wayaqdir ۚ wafariḥū bil ḥayātid dunyā wa mal ḥayātud dunyā fil-ākhirati illā matā`

ayas.arabic: وَيَقُولُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لَوْلَآ أُنزِلَ عَلَيْهِ ءَايَةٌ مِّن رَّبِّهِۦ ۗ قُلْ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يُضِلُّ مَن يَشَآءُ وَيَهْدِىٓ إِلَيْهِ مَنْ أَنَابَ
ayas.translation: The unbelievers say: "How is it that no miracle was sent down to him by his Lord?" Say: "God leads whosoever He wills astray, and guides whoever turns to Him in repentance.
ayas.transliteration: wayaqūlul ladhīna kafarū lawlā unzila `alayhi āyatun min rabbih ۗ qul innallāha yuḍillu man yashā-u wayahdī ilayhi man anāb

ayas.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَتَطْمَئِنُّ قُلُوبُهُم بِذِكْرِ ٱللَّهِ ۗ أَلَا بِذِكْرِ ٱللَّهِ تَطْمَئِنُّ ٱلْقُلُوبُ
ayas.translation: Those who believe and find peace in their hearts from the contemplation of God: Surely there is peace of heart in the contemplation of God!"
ayas.transliteration: alladhīna āmanū wataṭma-innu qulūbuhum bidhikrillāh ۗ alā bidhikrillāhi taṭma-innul qulūb

ayas.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ طُوبَىٰ لَهُمْ وَحُسْنُ مَـَٔابٍ
ayas.translation: Those who believe and do the right, have happiness, and an excellent resting place.
ayas.transliteration: alladhīna āmanū wa`amiluṣ ṣāliḥāti ṭūbā lahum waḥusnu ma-āb

ayas.arabic: كَذَٰلِكَ أَرْسَلْنَـٰكَ فِىٓ أُمَّةٍ قَدْ خَلَتْ مِن قَبْلِهَآ أُمَمٌ لِّتَتْلُوَا۟ عَلَيْهِمُ ٱلَّذِىٓ أَوْحَيْنَآ إِلَيْكَ وَهُمْ يَكْفُرُونَ بِٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ ۚ قُلْ هُوَ رَبِّى لَآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ عَلَيْهِ تَوَكَّلْتُ وَإِلَيْهِ مَتَابِ
ayas.translation: That is how We have sent you to a people before whom many a people have come and gone, so that you may announce to them whatever We have revealed to you. But they do not believe in Ar-Rahman. Tell them: "He is my Lord. There is no other god but He. In Him have I placed my trust, and to Him is my reversion."
ayas.transliteration: kadhālika arsalnāka fī ummatin qad khalat min qablihā umamul litatluwa `alayhimul ladhī awḥaynā ilayka wahum yakfurūna bir raḥmān ۚ qul huwa rabbī lā ilāha illā huwa `alayhi tawakkaltu wa ilayhi matāb

ayas.arabic: وَلَوْ أَنَّ قُرْءَانًا سُيِّرَتْ بِهِ ٱلْجِبَالُ أَوْ قُطِّعَتْ بِهِ ٱلْأَرْضُ أَوْ كُلِّمَ بِهِ ٱلْمَوْتَىٰ ۗ بَل لِّلَّهِ ٱلْأَمْرُ جَمِيعًا ۗ أَفَلَمْ يَا۟يْـَٔسِ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ أَن لَّوْ يَشَآءُ ٱللَّهُ لَهَدَى ٱلنَّاسَ جَمِيعًا ۗ وَلَا يَزَالُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ تُصِيبُهُم بِمَا صَنَعُوا۟ قَارِعَةٌ أَوْ تَحُلُّ قَرِيبًا مِّن دَارِهِمْ حَتَّىٰ يَأْتِىَ وَعْدُ ٱللَّهِ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يُخْلِفُ ٱلْمِيعَادَ
ayas.translation: Had there been a Qur'an which could have made the mountains move, or the earth to cleave asunder, or the dead to speak, yet all authority belongs to God. Have the believers not learnt that if God had so willed He could have guided all mankind? As for unbelievers, they will be visited by misfortune endlessly for what they have done; or it would sit in their homes till the promised threat of God comes to pass. Surely God does not go back on His promise.
ayas.transliteration: walaw anna qur-ānan suyyirat bihil jibālu aw quṭṭi`at bihil-arḍu aw kullima bihil mawtā ۗ bal lillāhil-amru jamī`ā ۗ afalam yay-asil ladhīna āmanū an law yashā-ullāhu lahadan nāsa jamī`ā ۗ walā yazālul ladhīna kafarū tuṣībuhum bimā ṣana`ū qāri`atun aw taḥullu qarīban min dārihim ḥattā ya-tiya wa`dullāh ۚ innallāha lā yukhliful mī`ād

ayas.arabic: وَلَقَدِ ٱسْتُهْزِئَ بِرُسُلٍ مِّن قَبْلِكَ فَأَمْلَيْتُ لِلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ ثُمَّ أَخَذْتُهُمْ ۖ فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عِقَابِ
ayas.translation: Many an apostle have they mocked before you; but I allowed the unbelievers respite, then I seized them. How severe was My punishment then!
ayas.transliteration: walaqadis-tuhzi-a birusulin min qablika fa-amlaytu lilladhīna kafarū thumma akhadhtuhum ۖ fakayfa kāna `iqāb

ayas.arabic: أَفَمَنْ هُوَ قَآئِمٌ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ نَفْسٍۭ بِمَا كَسَبَتْ ۗ وَجَعَلُوا۟ لِلَّهِ شُرَكَآءَ قُلْ سَمُّوهُمْ ۚ أَمْ تُنَبِّـُٔونَهُۥ بِمَا لَا يَعْلَمُ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ أَم بِظَـٰهِرٍ مِّنَ ٱلْقَوْلِ ۗ بَلْ زُيِّنَ لِلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ مَكْرُهُمْ وَصُدُّوا۟ عَنِ ٱلسَّبِيلِ ۗ وَمَن يُضْلِلِ ٱللَّهُ فَمَا لَهُۥ مِنْ هَادٍ
ayas.translation: Who is it who stands (watch) over every soul for what it does? Yet they ascribe compeers to God. Say: "Then name them. Or are you announcing to God what He does not know on the earth? Or is it only empty talk? In fact, the unbelievers' plots are made to look attractive to them, so that they are held back from the right path. Whosoever God allows to go astray has none to show him the way.
ayas.transliteration: afaman huwa qā-imun `alā kulli nafsin bimā kasabat ۗ waja`alū lillāhi shurakā-a qul sammūhum ۚ am tunabbi-ūnahu bimā lā ya`lamu fil-arḍi am biẓāhirin minal qawl ۗ bal zuyyina lilladhīna kafarū makruhum waṣuddū `anis sabīl ۗ wa man yuḍlilillāhu famā lahu min hād

ayas.arabic: لَّهُمْ عَذَابٌ فِى ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا ۖ وَلَعَذَابُ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ أَشَقُّ ۖ وَمَا لَهُم مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ مِن وَاقٍ
ayas.translation: For them is punishment in this world; and the punishment of the world to come is far more severe. They will have no one to save them from God.
ayas.transliteration: lahum `adhābun fil ḥayātid dunyā ۖ wala`adhābul-ākhirati ashaqq ۖ wa mā lahum minallāhi min wāq

ayas.arabic: مَّثَلُ ٱلْجَنَّةِ ٱلَّتِى وُعِدَ ٱلْمُتَّقُونَ ۖ تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهَا ٱلْأَنْهَـٰرُ ۖ أُكُلُهَا دَآئِمٌ وَظِلُّهَا ۚ تِلْكَ عُقْبَى ٱلَّذِينَ ٱتَّقَوا۟ ۖ وَّعُقْبَى ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ ٱلنَّارُ
ayas.translation: The likeness of Paradise promised the pious and devout is (of a garden) with streams of rippling water, everlasting fruits and shade. This is the recompense of those who keep away from evil; but the recompense of those who deny the truth is Hell.
ayas.transliteration: mathalul jannatil latī wu`idal muttaqūn ۖ tajrī min taḥtihal-anhār ۖ ukuluhā dā-imun waẓilluhā ۚ tilka `uqbal ladhīnat-taqaw ۖ wa`uqbal kāfirīnan nār

ayas.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَاتَيْنَـٰهُمُ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ يَفْرَحُونَ بِمَآ أُنزِلَ إِلَيْكَ ۖ وَمِنَ ٱلْأَحْزَابِ مَن يُنكِرُ بَعْضَهُۥ ۚ قُلْ إِنَّمَآ أُمِرْتُ أَنْ أَعْبُدَ ٱللَّهَ وَلَآ أُشْرِكَ بِهِۦٓ ۚ إِلَيْهِ أَدْعُوا۟ وَإِلَيْهِ مَـَٔابِ
ayas.translation: Those to whom We have given the Scriptures rejoice in what We have sent down to you; but some of their factions reject some of it. Tell them: "I am commanded to worship only God, and not to associate compeers with Him. To Him I call you, and to Him is the destination."
ayas.transliteration: wal ladhīna ātaynāhumul kitāba yafraḥūna bimā unzila ilayk ۖ wa minal-aḥzābi man yunkiru ba`ḍah ۚ qul innamā umirtu an a`budallāha walā ushrika bih ۚ ilayhi ad`ū wa ilayhi ma-āb

ayas.arabic: وَكَذَٰلِكَ أَنزَلْنَـٰهُ حُكْمًا عَرَبِيًّا ۚ وَلَئِنِ ٱتَّبَعْتَ أَهْوَآءَهُم بَعْدَ مَا جَآءَكَ مِنَ ٱلْعِلْمِ مَا لَكَ مِنَ ٱللَّهِ مِن وَلِىٍّ وَلَا وَاقٍ
ayas.translation: That is how We have sent down this (Qur'an) as a code of clear judgement. But if you follow their caprices, now that you have been given knowledge, you will have no friend or protector against God.
ayas.transliteration: wakadhālika anzalnāhu ḥukman `arabiyyā ۚ wala-init-taba`ta ahwā-ahum ba`da mā jā-aka minal `il-mi mā laka minallāhi min waliyyin walā wāq

ayas.arabic: وَلَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا رُسُلًا مِّن قَبْلِكَ وَجَعَلْنَا لَهُمْ أَزْوَٰجًا وَذُرِّيَّةً ۚ وَمَا كَانَ لِرَسُولٍ أَن يَأْتِىَ بِـَٔايَةٍ إِلَّا بِإِذْنِ ٱللَّهِ ۗ لِكُلِّ أَجَلٍ كِتَابٌ
ayas.translation: We sent many apostles before you, and bestowed on them wives and children, but it was not for any apostle to come up with a miracle unless by the leave of God. For every age there is a law.
ayas.transliteration: walaqad arsalnā rusulan min qablika waja`alnā lahum azwājan wadhurriyyah ۚ wa mā kāna lirasūlin an ya-tiya bi-āyatin illā bi-idhnillāh ۗ likulli ajalin kitāb

ayas.arabic: يَمْحُوا۟ ٱللَّهُ مَا يَشَآءُ وَيُثْبِتُ ۖ وَعِندَهُۥٓ أُمُّ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ
ayas.translation: God abrogates or confirms whatsoever He will, for He has with Him the Book of Books.
ayas.transliteration: yamḥullāhu mā yashā-u wayuthbit ۖ wa`indahu ummul kitāb

ayas.arabic: وَإِن مَّا نُرِيَنَّكَ بَعْضَ ٱلَّذِى نَعِدُهُمْ أَوْ نَتَوَفَّيَنَّكَ فَإِنَّمَا عَلَيْكَ ٱلْبَلَـٰغُ وَعَلَيْنَا ٱلْحِسَابُ
ayas.translation: Whether We allow you to see (the punishment) We have promised them, or end your life before (its execution), it is certainly for you to convey the message; the reckoning is for Us to do.
ayas.transliteration: wa in mā nuriyannaka ba`ḍal ladhī na`iduhum aw natawaffayannaka fa-innamā `alaykal balāghu wa`alaynal ḥisāb

ayas.arabic: أَوَلَمْ يَرَوْا۟ أَنَّا نَأْتِى ٱلْأَرْضَ نَنقُصُهَا مِنْ أَطْرَافِهَا ۚ وَٱللَّهُ يَحْكُمُ لَا مُعَقِّبَ لِحُكْمِهِۦ ۚ وَهُوَ سَرِيعُ ٱلْحِسَابِ
ayas.translation: Do they not see Us advancing from all sides into their land and reducing its frontiers? It is for God to judge; and there is none to reverse His judgement. He is swift at reckoning.
ayas.transliteration: awalam yaraw annā na-til-arḍa nanquṣuhā min aṭrāfihā ۚ wallāhu yaḥkumu lā mu`aqqiba liḥukmih ۚ wahuwa sarī`ul ḥisāb

ayas.arabic: وَقَدْ مَكَرَ ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ فَلِلَّهِ ٱلْمَكْرُ جَمِيعًا ۖ يَعْلَمُ مَا تَكْسِبُ كُلُّ نَفْسٍ ۗ وَسَيَعْلَمُ ٱلْكُفَّـٰرُ لِمَنْ عُقْبَى ٱلدَّارِ
ayas.translation: Surely those who had gone before them had also plotted; but God's is all the planning, for He has knowledge of what each does. The unbelievers will soon learn for whom is the guerdon of Paradise.
ayas.transliteration: waqad makaral ladhīna min qablihim falillāhil makru jamī`ā ۖ ya`lamu mā taksibu kullu nafs ۗ wasaya`lamul kuffāru liman `uqbad dār

ayas.arabic: وَيَقُولُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لَسْتَ مُرْسَلًا ۚ قُلْ كَفَىٰ بِٱللَّهِ شَهِيدًۢا بَيْنِى وَبَيْنَكُمْ وَمَنْ عِندَهُۥ عِلْمُ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ
ayas.translation: Yet those who are disbelievers say: "You are not the apostle sent (by God)." Tell them: "God is sufficient as witness between me and you, and he who has knowledge of the Book."
ayas.transliteration: wayaqūlul ladhīna kafarū lasta mursalā ۚ qul kafā billāhi shahīdan baynī wabaynakum wa man `indahu `il-mul kitāb
